title: Deploy a PostgreSQL database for OO Workflow Designer
content:
To deploy OO Workflow Designer using PostgreSQL, you must have an existing PostgreSQL database service. If you need to create a new database service, see the relevant documentation provided by PostgreSQL because this information isn't included in this guide. However, this topic contains recommendations for the PostgreSQL configuration.

Workflow for PostgreSQL deployment

To deploy OO Workflow Designer using PostgreSQL, perform the following steps:

  1. Review sizing guidelines.
  2. Review system requirements for the PostgreSQL database
  3. Configure PostgreSQL.
  4. Manually create an OO Workflow Designer database on the PostgreSQL server.

Review sizing guidelines

For information to review sizing guidelines, see Set up database environment for OO Workflow Designer topic.

System requirements for PostgreSQL database

For the supported PostgreSQL database versions, see the System requirements topic.

Language support

PostgreSQL determines character set and collation at the database level. The OO Workflow Designer database uses Unicode (utf8) encoding and collation. This lets you use any Unicode character (and practically all common characters in all languages).

Configure PostgreSQL database

This topic contains information on OO Workflow Designer PostgreSQL configuration settings. 

Legend:

  • Mandatory configuration options/values appear in bold text.
  • Recommended configuration options/values appear in the bold Italic text.
  • Supported configuration options/values appear in normal font, and may show as a comma separated list.
Instance Configuration Options Mandatory Recommended Supported
max_connections >= 1000
default_transaction_isolation 'read committed'
autovacuum on
track_counts on
shared_buffers >=512MB¹
effective_cache_size >=2048MB¹
work_mem >=64MB¹
maintenance_work_mem >=256MB¹
lc_messages 'en_US.UTF-8' Any
lc_monetary 'en_US.UTF-8' Any

¹ Minimal values. See the PostgreSQL documentation on how to tune these values by your environment.

Manually create an OO Workflow Designer database on the PostgreSQL server

The OO Workflow Designer installation wizard gives the following options during installation:

  • Create a new OO Workflow Designer database, user, and password on your chosen database server or instance.
  • Connect to an existing OO Workflow Designer database on your chosen database server or instance.

Create an OO Workflow Designer database using the OO Workflow Designer installation wizard

Role Location Privileges required
System administrator, Database administrator, or any user Database server using the installation wizard Data Definition Language (DDL) and Data Manipulation Language (DML)

To create an OO Workflow Designer database:

  1. In the Database configuration screen of the installation wizard, select Create the database/schema option.
  2. Enter the user credentials having CREATE database privileges. For example, postgres
  3. Create a new OO Workflow Designer database and database user.

At this point, only the database, login, and user are created. Objects such as tables and indexes get created when OO starts for the first time after installation.

To connect to an existing OO Workflow Designer database:

  1. Make sure the database name and user are already created on the desired database server or instance.
  2. In the Database configuration screen of the installation wizard, select Connect to an existing database/schema option.
  3. Enter the existing database name and user credentials to establish a connection. For example, oodesignerdb and oodesignerdbuser.

Create an OO Workflow Designer database using the PostgreSQL database server

Role Location Privileges required
Database administrator or any user Database server using the installation wizard DDL and DML

If you're an authorized user with elevated privileges to create a new OO Workflow Designer database but don't wish to create an OO database using the installation wizard. Then you may request your organization's database administrator to create an OO Workflow Designer database and the user name of your choice. After the database administrator creates the OO Workflow Designer database and user for you with the required permission, you can then connect to an existing database using basic privileges.

Review the following general notes for a database administrator:

  • The built-in postgres user has all the required privileges. Use a login that has CREATEUSER and CREATEDB privileges at least.
  • Perform the create database procedures only if you are an experienced PostgreSQL Server database administrator.
  • If you prefer to use the PgAdmin GUI, make sure you select all options that correspond with the SQL code presented in the below instructions.
  • Not all database creation options are specified—only those that differ from the default value. When in doubt, use default values.

To create a database on the PostgreSQL server:

  1. You can use the create database scripts from:
    1. The downloaded and extracted installation zip at: <oo_version>\config\sql\Designer\Postgres\<PostgreSQL_version>
    2. The downloaded and extracted database scripts from ITOM Marketplace at: OO_Database_Creation\Designer\PostgreSQL\<PostgreSQL_version>
  2. Log in to PostgreSQL Server as postgres or any other login role with CREATEUSER and CREATEDB privileges.
  3. Navigate to the create database script from the extracted zip packages at: <oo_version>\config\sql\Designer\Postgres\<PostgreSQL_version> or OO_Database_Creation\Designer\PostgreSQL\<PostgreSQL_version>
  4. Edit and run the script postgres_create_wd_db.sql and then verify that the database, login, and user are created successfully. You may have to adapt the script parameters to match your environment. 
  5. (Optional) To verify that you can create the database objects by the new login and user:
    1. Connect to the PostgreSQL database server.
    2. Log in using the OO Workflow Designer’s newly created login role credentials.
    3. Navigate to the test database script from the extracted zip packages at: <oo_version>\config\sql\Designer\Postgres\<PostgreSQL_version> or OO_Database_Creation\Designer\PostgreSQL\<PostgreSQL_version> 
    4. Run the database test script postgres_create_test_table.sql and then verify that the script ran correctly without any errors or warnings.

Configure TLS on PostgreSQL

You can establish connectivity with OO Workflow Designer using the SSL protocol with the JDBC driver.

To configure your existing environment to connect to a PostgreSQL instance using JDBC through SSL protocol:

  1. Stop the OO Workflow Designer.
  2. Log in to your PostgreSQL Server and enable an SSL connection. 
  3. Copy the trusted root certificate from the PostgreSQL server onto the bin folder at <INSTALL_DIRECTORY>\Operations Orchestration\designer\bin.

  4. Backup and modify the database property file by replacing the highlighted values in the JDBC URL to fit your own environment:

    jdbc.url=jdbc\:postgresql\://<DB_IP_OR_HOSTNAME>:<DB_PORT>/<DB_NAME>?ssl=true&sslmode=verify-ca&sslrootcert=<CertificateAuthority.crt>

  5. Start OO Workflow Designer.
